To p.shang;  Furthering the business of bursting bubbles; The internet is not an American invention. but should be described as being a canada/usa joint venture.  Consider investigating the Canadian aviation program known as AV Roe. Three groups of very intelligent people were brought together to create a cutting edge aircraft. As the design engineers began work, they realized that the "human" element was a major problem, and therefore decided to create a previously unheard of system which is now called "fly by wire". These people theorized, designed, and built the first "super computer". It worked, as did the complete "fly by wire" sensor system. Canada also had created the DEW LINE, which was our northern defense network. The "AV ROE program was tasked to produce a very long range fight/bomber, and the work was accomplished. Upon completion of our incredible aircraft, a us president arrived in Canada with his security detail, took Diefenbaker out on a fishing trip, and somehow got that simple bastard to hand over the AVRO, it's optional lunar entry module, the plans, and all of the support parts and equipment. Odd as it seems, Diefenbaker wasn't charged with treason or conspiracy. He certainly should have, and that is the consensus here in Canada. Incidentally, the plans and ideas for each facet of the computer came from Nicola Tesla. As did the idea of wireless communication, which was proven during the 1943 us supreme court case involving Tesla and Marconi. Tesla was awarded the patent for "radio".  Research Nicola Tesla.
